intro: Ozoroa verticillata, commonly known as the clustered false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clustered inflorescence of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a herbaceous growth habit. Its leaves are opposite and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Ozoroa verticillata is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a resilient and widespread species in its native range.
